Posts.Content: Thank you London Lass.  Needed that hug.  That's it exactly.  Poor hubby thinks he is being encouraging saying he can see it growing but all I see is my scalp shining through the fuzz.
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: Don't mind my patchy brows, they look better drawn on anyway & I have 1/2 length lashes now.  I am a terribly impatient person anyway so it's just frustrating me something awful waiting for the hair on my head to thicken up.
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: Yes I think the Taxil affected my hair & nails more than the fec.  Unless the effects were very delayed.
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: Curly hair would be a whole new nightmare for me. Haha. Just 16 radiotherapy to go & it's over but the hair is a reminder that psychologically I could do without.  Want to be me again, abate me with short hair for the first time in nearly 30 years.
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: Know I am just being impatient but lack of hair regrowth really getting me down now.  Had my last chemo 7th September and I still have just thin fuzz.  Just want to look at myself without the constant reminder that I have had cancer.  Feels like it's never going to grow back.  Someone said docetaxel can cause permanent hair loss.  Is this going to be it now?  I need cheering up girls.
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: My surgeon also never mentioned lymphoedema.  Assume the risk varies depending on the number of nodes they remove & that he felt it was a low enough number not to be worth mentioning but that's maybe me being naive.  Only had a little swelling at the lymph removal site after surgery & it went down by itself in a week anyway.
Posts.Title: Axillary clearance post surgery swelling or lymphodema?

Posts.Content: My surgeon also never mentioned lymphoedema.  Assume the risk varies depending on the number of nodes they remove & that he felt it was a low enough number not to be worth mentioning but that's maybe me being naive.  Only had a little swelling at the lymph removal site after surgery & it went down by itself in a week anyway.
Posts.Title: Axillary clearance post surgery swelling or lymphodema?

Posts.Content: Had my final round of chemo 7th sept and lumpectomy on 19th October.  Thought radiotherapy would start 4 weeks after surgery & all would be done & dusted in a year but not scheduled to start till 4th January.  Still I am happy to get to spend Christmas at home.  Hope you have a great holiday away from it all.
Posts.Title: Gap between chemo and surgery and radiation

Posts.Content: Don't even let it enter your head that 'you won't survive', cancer isn't going to beat you.  (Cue 'Eye of the tiger') You are going to whoop its ass. Enjoy your Christmas & hope your family spoil you rotten. You are under orders to let them and take it easy. X
Posts.Title: New day, new attitude

Posts.Content: You need to speak to your nurse about the nausea & if you are still feeling it I wouldn't wait till the next round, phone on Monday.  I was told don't put up with nausea there are lots of different meds they can give for it.  They start with the cheapest & hope you will manage on them.  I didn't. They just gave me domperadone to start with.  I forget what other ones they gave me but I got stronger ones to combine with it.  Nurse also said I could double the domperadone.  Don't suffer in silence.  The new meds worked for me though it took longer with each round for the nausea to stop.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: You know what to expect now so other rounds should be easier especially if they get you on something better for the nausea.  I even went off in a boat fishing with my hubby in week 3, no nausea at all & I normally get seasick.   As for being a couch potato don't beat yourself up over it.  Staying active helps with the tiredness but you should also listen to your body.  Staying active on some days is a 10 minute wander/waddle/hobble round the garden.  Other days it's an hour long walk on the beach.  I pushed myself to hard to be active on round 2 and got run down & secondary infections.  Scared myself thinking oh no don't tell me it will be like this every time.  It wasn't. I learned my lesson & took it easy particularly in the first week.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: I live in Scotland so a little different.  They had a wig lady come to the chemo ward with samples & ordered for you.
Posts.Title: Wig advice

Posts.Content: My feet pealed during chemo as well.  Had to force myself not to pick & just keep moisturising.  They only pealed once and healed up in a couple of weeks.  Try letting the air get to your feet.  Bit cold for bare feet but try just socks.   As for aching nails I can't help much.  Do remember mine being a bit tender but again it eased off fairly quickly.  Do remember reading somewhere avoiding long soaks in bath etc as may cause nails to lift off.  I was paranoid about losing my nails, far more than my hair.  Avoided baths and moisturised every day and have managed to keep them.  Perhaps you could try almond oil or cuticle oil on them to strengthen them? Know what you mean about feeling like an 80 year old.  Especially my right leg for some reason.  I am four months post chemo now though & energy is back to normal.  You will get there.
Posts.Title: Side effects of fec-t on feet and body

Posts.Content: Haven't been trough it myself but recommendations from those who have included taking painkillers an hour or so before you go & make sure you have something warm to wear.  Try and take your mind off it with a book, game or music. I didn't cold cap & 9 months after finishing chemo I still have thin hair on top of my head & bald spots on my crown & nape of my neck so I wish I had gone for the cold cap.  Stick with it hon. Xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer, hair loss and sheer worry

Posts.Content: Would hope your Consultant wouldn't have prescribed the Tamoxifen if the chances of endometrial or uterine cancer were increased by the same percentage as the decrease in breast cancer recurrence.  Would be worth discussing the trade off with him.  Until then I would try the Tamoxifen & see how you get on with it.  You may find you get on much better with it and don’t have any problems. If the consultant can’t put your mind at rest that taking it doesn’t increase your risk of other cancers by the same factor as the protection that it offers then I would stop taking it. It’s not a choice for me as the percentage of protection for me is much higher. In honesty if it only gave me a 2% improvement in the chance of preventing a recurrence I probably wouldn’t keep up with taking it as for me getting rid of the hot flushes would be worth the increased risk.
Posts.Title: TAMOXIFEN - HONEST OPINIONS PLEASE

Posts.Content: The aches and shooting pains are normal.  I had them while waiting for treatment and through chemo.  Just have to take it a bit easy & be kind to yourself.  I am also normally an active person, a weekend indoors is a weekend wasted to me.  Finished my treatment (other than Tamoxifen) at the end of January and I am back to my normal active self.
Posts.Title: The waiting game!

Posts.Content: Just posted on your other thread as I was wondering how you were doing.  Really pleased you are improving & they let you home.  Good luck with the new job.
Posts.Title: THANKYOU SO MUCH

Posts.Content: A really interesting read, though scary if you haven't been through your chemo yet.  Have to say I didnt feel as bad for as long and the anti sickness meds worked for me.  Had FEC-T before Docetaxel and so have the other people I have spoken to.  Also didn't get anti biotics & anti fungals to take as a preventive? Did anyone else?  Thankfully also only got single bone marrow boosting injections not the daily ones she had such a bad reaction to as well.  Did wonder why my nose ran all the time through chemo, never occurred to me till I read this that it was because my nose hair had fallen out.   Really highlights all the things that doctors/nurses don't tell you though, in that regard her experience is the same as mine.  Particularly gynecological changes which did make me really angry at the time.  Felt like the attitude was 'you should be grateful to be alive, you cant expect a sex life as well'.  Hope she goes back to work as she would be a fantastic breast surgeon now.
Posts.Title: Breast Surgeon With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Changed to decaf to help with the hot flushes and cut back on alcohol but nothing else.  Already grow my own veg & me & hubby go sea fishing so lots of fish in diet.
Posts.Title: Changes to diet

Posts.Content: If you are currently going through chemo new lumps shouldn't really be growing, chemo's job is to stop this so the doctors guesses about a cyst etc are more likely. Know its hard but try not to worry.  Hugs.
Posts.Title: So worried - 2 new lumps in my other breast

Posts.Content: One of the veins in the crook of my arm went rigid like a piano wire with FEC-T.  It felt tight & uncomfortable but eased off by itself after a couple of weeks. It's still a bit tight compared to the other arm if I push down on it but I don't notice it anymore, it's not uncomfortable. I finished chemo in September & suspect in a few months will be back to normal.
Posts.Title: FECing Veins!

Posts.Content: Had pain in my right breast last year that I dismissed as the underwire in my bra poking me when I was gardening.  Roll forward to this spring & noticed the lump in the same place as the pain.  Think there needs to be a serious re think on the 'breast cancer' doesn't present with pain as I don't believe for a second now that it was a coincidence.
Posts.Title: Was this the start?

Posts.Content: Theresa28 Thank you Dreamthief - will definitely be giving the Exestamane my best shot as this is the option they are going to offer me. I will be keeping everything crossed that this will work for me. As for vaginal dryness, I have tried KY Jelly and Sylk, but not YES, so will give it a try. Many thanks. Also tried Sylk & Yes Yes but they are both water based and disappear almost straight away.  Might not be as hypoallergenic (though it is perfume free) but I prefer silicone based ID Velvet.  It leaves your skin lovely and soft as well and doesn't disappear.  I did struggle with pain when trying to have sex after chemotherapy.  I found pelvic floor exercises and dilators helped.  You can either get dilators on prescription or if you want to save yourself the embarrassment they are also available online from places like Amazon.  Its the one thing no doctor or nurse will bring up unless you do first yet its one of the most distressing side effects of cancer treatment.
Posts.Title: Stopping Letrazole

Posts.Content: Hope all went well for you yesterday Loulou & you are feeling ok today though doubtless tired.  If you are taking all your nausea meds but still feeling sick be sure and call your Macmillan or Breast Cancer nurse & they can advise on changing the dose or arrange a prescription for something stronger.  They start with the cheapest meds & hope they will work for you but if not there are plenty of other things they can give you.  Try and keep up with your fluids.  I found water that I usually drink ltrs of a day tasted awful during FEC-T but adding apple squash helped.  Others recommend tonic water.   Ginger nuts are good for the nausea & bad taste in your mouth as well.  Big hug, take it easy & be kind to yourself.
Posts.Title: Fidst chemo session tomorrow

Posts.Content: Oh I am pleased for you though it would be a very unreasonable boss that didn't let you go for a doctors appointment.  My boss has been fantastic.  Any time I apologise for having to take time off for treatment he always says 'your health comes first, we want you back healthy.' Even though my contact says I don't get sick pay he has also paid me for all the time I have had off.  Feeling guilty about being the recipient of such generosity I have tried to use my holiday allowance as much as possible to cover my treatment.   Also feel guilty because I know he wants me to accept a promotion but I don't want the extra stress in my life especially now.  If anything I would like to cut back my hours but every time I have mentioned it prior to my diagnosis the expression of horror on his face has made me relent.
Posts.Title: Looking Positive :)

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear you have suffered so much from your radiotherapy.  I seem to have got off very lightly.  Some brown patches round my nipple and in my armpit but other than a bit of tenderness in my nipple for a couple of days it seems to have settled down fine.  Only further advice I can offer is don’t over wash the area.  I used to shower every day but through radiotherapy and for the last two weeks after its finished I cut back to twice a week.  Don’t want to strip the oils from my skin or get it damp.  I use baby wipes in my armpit on that side to keep it clean between washes.  Seems to be working for me. Hope you are on the mend soon.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Can't help with the mastectomy but also wanted to say your friend is lucky to have someone show such concern & interest in her.  If you can suggest this site to her as well I think she would find it a big support as she will get to speak her conserns to people who are going through or have come out the other side of all the things she is going through.  All of us on here I think would advise her to avoid looking on google for answers as there is a lot of scary/inaccurate & irrelevant stuff on there.  We are always here (lol due to lots of insomnia pretty much 24/7).
Posts.Title: Procedure

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear you have suffered so much from your radiotherapy.  I seem to have got off very lightly.  Some brown patches round my nipple and in my armpit but other than a bit of tenderness in my nipple for a couple of days it seems to have settled down fine.  Only further advice I can offer is don’t over wash the area.  I used to shower every day but through radiotherapy and for the last two weeks after its finished I cut back to twice a week.  Don’t want to strip the oils from my skin or get it damp.  I use baby wipes in my armpit on that side to keep it clean between washes.  Seems to be working for me. Hope you are on the mend soon.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Ear plugs.  When I was hospitalised during chemo there were two Alzheimer's patients on the ward across from the isolation room they had me in who were disoriented & shouting all night.  Had to get the other half to bring me ear plugs.  That and a phone charger.
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Finished my radiotherapy at the end of January and just trying to get back into a normal routine & forget I ever had cancer then come home to NHS envelope.  Appointment letter for follow up CT scan to check the wee lump they found before chemo in my lung.  Oncologist at the time said lots of people have them & they aren't cancerous, try not to worry about it.  Appointment isn't for a whole month.  Now going to have it popping into my head with 'what ifs' till then.  Waa.  Just want it to be over.
Posts.Title: Just when I was trying to get back to normal

Posts.Content: Everyone is different but I found the first round was the worst for the aches & pains.  They got progressively easier till with the last one I didn't need pain killers.  During the first one I alternated paracetamol & ibuprofen so I was covered by pain killers 24hours.   When my mouth was at its worst I am afraid I was just living off icecream, jelly & bananas.  Oh and super noodles.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel (Taxotere) Aches & Pains!!

Posts.Content: Keep them & the cuticle well moisturised and wear gloves for cleaning (or better yet use it as an excuse to get someone else to do the cleaning! Lol).  Mine discoloured like bruised underneath on the last treatment.  The ridges started showing after the last round.  They delaminated from each ridge forward but like you they had thickened and there was healthy nail underneath.  I didn’t actually completely lose any nails.  Finished chemo in September and all the ridges on my finger nails grew out by January.  Toe nails are a bit behind but again didn't lose any.
Posts.Title: Nails on 'T'

Posts.Content: Some of my nails thickened so much on chemo cutting them I was reminded of the housekeeper in Father Ted trying to cut father Jack's toe nails armed with a welding mask and bolt cutters.
Posts.Title: Nails on 'T'

Posts.Content: Wonderful news JMC, really pleased for you.
Posts.Title: More shrinkage on 'T' chemo.

Posts.Content: mistymoley Doing it without all the facts is just pointless and making them up is going to scare w.. My oncologist gave me 98 and 97% with and without Tamoxifen. That's good enough for me. I really don't want to know if I'm going to die tomorrow, I live life as though I am going to be here for at least the next few years and frankly most people don't plan that far ahead. We have holidays booked to the end of November next year, after that, who knows?!  Am I reading that right Helen?  There is only a 1% improvement in odd by taking Tamoxifen?  Really resent all the side effects as it is but if they only improve my chances by 1% it doesn't seem worth the heart ache.
Posts.Title: Predict

Posts.Content: Brilliant news WORRIED2016, so chuffed for you.  Have a fantastic Christmas.
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: I had aching in the actual tumour but also shooting pain across the whole breast/chest wall and into the armpit.  Thankfully it didn't last long and it was at the stage when my lump was shrinking so I welcomed it as a sign that the chemo was working.  Post surgery I have no pain at all.  Fingers crossed is the same for you but if you are still worried speak to your breast or MacMillan nurse.
Posts.Title: Breast pain whilst on chemo

Posts.Content: You should use a condom for the first four days I think after chemo to protect your partner but after that he is safe.  You do still need to use some form of contraception to avoid pregnancy.  Like you I wasn't really interested in sex through chemo and even if I was my insides felt like my mouth.  I did find sex uncomfortable or even painful for a while after and was worried I would never get back to normal & there are some very negative articles on the internet but one thing I found that was really great was this; http://prc.coh.org/A-Z%20Booklet%209-14.pdf Its written in a positive funny way with practical advice that worked for me.  Give the pelvic floor exercises a go, think you will find that helps you get back to normal.
Posts.Title: Sex after chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Depends on a couple of things, are you 'cold capping' and if your hospital uses iv pumps to administer.  Think to be honest the answer to the last one will almost certainly be yes. The rather traditionalist head nurse in my local hospital didn’t like them so all the chemo there is administered by hand syringe which adds a bit of time. If you aren’t ‘cold capping’ I would plan on being there an hour though from memory it was a bit less than that. If you are ‘cold capping’ then it will be quite a lot longer but I didn’t do it (unfortunately) so I couldn’t say how long it would take. If there isn’t someone going with you to keep you company take a book or something with you to pass the time.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: How long do Chemo treatments take?

Posts.Content: I am thankful for so much, my other half for bullying me into going to the doctor & being my rock all through this. For the wonderful kindness shown to me  by lots of lovely nurses. For my employers who have gone above & beyond supporting me through my illness.  For Facebook. Without it I wouldn't have got back in touch with an old friend just as I was starting treatment who it turned out had been through the same thing two years ago and was a fantastic support.  For my family who have been there when I needed them & given me space when I needed that as well. My wish for 2017 is that everyone finding themselves in the same situation gets the support I was lucky enough to get.  That they find less brutal cures for us & that I get my act together, sort out a passport & go for my first ever holiday abroad.  Well you only live once. Oh and that I kick my rapidly developing addiction to Baileys.  Take care ladies and all the best for 2017.
Posts.Title: Two thanks and a Wish...

Posts.Content: My melon lump came up very quickly & felt about the size of a small plum.  It shrank through chemo to a grape.  Fruit salad anyone?  Haha.
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: My melon lump came up very quickly & felt about the size of a small plum.  It shrank through chemo to a grape.  Fruit salad anyone?  Haha.
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: You say you have food intolerances rather than allergies.  Think you will find chemo gives you similar symptoms to eating your bad foods anyway so you will find it hard to distinguish. Though I didn't have food intolerances as such I did have terrible constipation for years before chemo.  The chemo has finally sorted it.  It's an unexpected bonus.  Try & stay positive & don't expect to much of your body.  You may even find like me that chemo helps.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Multiple food intolerances and chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Bess, I finished Chemo in September though I didn't cold cap (wish I had), and my hair is still filling in now.  Would guess I have another month or more till the thin patches on my crown and back of my neck fill in and I can stop wearing hats to work.   Remember the lethargy well.  My right leg in particular felt heavy and tired.  It slowly improved over the next couple of month though and now I am full of my usual bounce.  Going for walks helped I think.  I am on Tamoxifen as well but thankfully no aches and pains with it.  I do get hot flushes a couple of times through the night so dont get an uninterrupted night's sleep anymore.  That just means I enjoy a lie in now instead of springing out of bed at 5am & bugging my other half to get up so its not proving to hard to cope with at the moment.    Fingers crossed you feel more yourself shortly. MoMo
Posts.Title: Post Chemo Fatigue and Hair!

Posts.Content: Oh Teresa my fingers are crossed for you.  Know you don't want to 'lose' another year to treatment after only just starting to get your life back together.  Hope your results come through quickly. X
Posts.Title: Please....not again

Posts.Content: I just used E45 through 19 rounds of radiotherapy.  Did have some brown patches at the end but no worse than sunburn & healed up quickly.  Staying hydrated to help your skin repair itself is important.  Don't over wash the area & strip the natural oils out of your skin either.  Aloe wipes were good for cleaning off the pen marks.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy questions

Posts.Content: Lucozade is a sports drink & its whole purpose is to re-hydrate you.  During chemo then I didn't worry about calories, if it tasted ok I ate it as there was so much that didn't.  During Docetaxel I spent a week in each cycle living off jelly & icecream my mouth was so sore.  No offence to your husband but he has no idea how bad things can taste on chemo.  Mine was the same, kept making 'helpful' suggestions that were anything but.  Off chemo I easily drink 2 litres a day of just water,  during FEC-T I couldn't stomach it at all unless I mixed apple squash in it.  I lost weight on chemo despite my less than healthy diet so I would just go with what works for you.
Posts.Title: Can i drink lucozade on chemo

Posts.Content: On a steroid high after my first round I thought 'this will be a doddle compared to FEC-T.  Then the wee man with the steamroller turned up & ran me over.  That's what it felt like anyway.  Could hardly walk.  Alternating paracetamol & ibuprofen made it bearable though & it eased of in a few days.  Thankful the first round was the worst & they got progressively easier.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Side Effects

Posts.Content: The docetaxel may have floored me but it was also the one that worked for me. FEC-T didn't do anything to my tumour but docetaxel halved it so that made it all worth while.  Even though I was aching I was extatic that I could feel it working.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Side Effects

Posts.Content: Shouldn't laugh but 'dead ferret taken up residence' did tickle me.  I described it as having someone come & upholster my tongue in used 1970's shagpile.  Maybe we should start a thread for 'best chemo mouth description' for a laugh. Xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Side Effects

Posts.Content: Wish I could help more but I just had a lumpectomy & I was in a right state before that as I was convinced I was going to wake up with Franken Boob.  Was so happy when I woke up to such a neat scar that I was bouncing off the ceiling.   Just try prepping your hospital bag (ear plugs, phone charger, lotion & soft loo roll were on my essentials list) so you feel as prepared as you can.  Hugs.
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!
